block.p: Cortney Lee Konner, a daughter of Randi Konner of New York and Jeffrey Konner of Fort Lee, N.J., was married last evening to Jamison Weinbaum, the son of Judith Robbins DiPierro of Ossining, N.Y., and George Weinbaum of Greenwich, Conn. Cantor Ilan Mamber officiated at the Grand Hyatt New York.

Mrs. Weinbaum, 25, is a consultant in Washington for Toffler Associates, which advises businesses and government agencies. She graduated from the University of Michigan. The bride is a stepdaughter of Barry Kirsch.

Cortney Lee Konner, a daughter of Randi Konner of New York and Jeffrey Konner of Fort Lee, N.J., was married last evening to Jamison Weinbaum, the son of Judith Robbins DiPierro of Ossining, N.Y., and George Weinbaum of Greenwich, Conn. Cantor Ilan Mamber officiated at the Grand Hyatt New York.

Cortney Lee Konner, a daughter of Randi Konner of New York and Jeffrey Konner of Fort Lee, N.J., was married last evening to Jamison Weinbaum, the son of Judith Robbins DiPierro of Ossining, N.Y., and George Weinbaum of Greenwich, Conn. Cantor Ilan Mamber officiated at the Grand Hyatt New York.

Mrs. Weinbaum, 25, is a consultant in Washington for Toffler Associates, which advises businesses and government agencies. She graduated from the University of Michigan. The bride is a stepdaughter of Barry Kirsch.

Mr. Weinbaum, 30, is an associate at Seyfarth Shaw, a law firm in Washington. He graduated from Wake Forest and received his law degree from George Washington. The bridegroom is the stepson of John DiPierro.
